ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a greater appreciation for Spanish and became more efficient and faster at translating medium-difficulty texts.
Deeper understanding of Spanish literature and reading skills
I learned a lot of great information about different Spanish cultures and felt like I have become a much more confident and accurate reader as a result of this class.
Improved my translation skills, both with non fiction and fiction texts. Learned common idioms and how to translate more formal texts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: 10/10. pace is great for those who already know spanish or don't know any spanish. texts are interesting and she asks what you're interested in too

Strengths- interesting readings, improved Spanish reading skills a lot 

Weakness- none
Laid back, able to practice your efficiency without worries. Assignments don't feel like chores, great environment.

I really like that the class is a relatively low stress environment where students are welcome to ask any questions. Also, if you stay on top of the material and do the work, you can get a lot out of the class. I wouldn't recommend changing it at all.

Strengthsthe chapter worksheets Professor Asensio provides are really helpful if you are new to Spanish or there are some aspects of the language you need more practice with. Professor Asensio is willing to explain or discuss grammatical or cultural questions you may have, and beside everyone has different levels of experience with Spanish, he course isnt too overwhelming. I dont think there are any weaknesses with the course

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes!!! if you just need an extra credit to fill your schedule or a break for spanish before going to the next level but wanna stay engaged with the language
Yes, it is a perfect 5th class if you already have an okay background in Spanish. Very low workload and the professor is super nice and easy going.
If you want to sharpen your reading skills then absolutely!
Yes, great environment if you're looking to improve your efficiency in Spanish at essentially any level. Workload is low and the assignments don't feel taxing and are rewarding
I would absolutely recommend this course. Not only is the material interesting, but the professor is a very kind, understanding person who truly cares about their students learning the material.

I would recommend this course to someone trying to improve their reading skills in Spanish, regardless of prior Spanish experience. The two projects of the course allow you to choose a text and lead the class in translating a portion, which affords you the opportunity to choose a text relevant to your field or the level of difficulty that you would like
